ch.ecma.csta.routeing

Interface RouteingServices


  • public interface RouteingServices
    A set of services that allow an application to become a routing server for a specific routing device or as a routing server for all routing devices within the switching sub-domain.

    Prerequisites Before attempting to use RouteingServices, do the following:

    1. Acquire an instance of ServiceProvider by using the ServiceProvider.getServiceProvider method.
    2. Acquire an instance of RouteingServices by using the ServiceProvider.getService method.

    Note that all supported RouteingServices requests are also available through AsynchronousServices.sendRequest. Consider using this service when you would like to not block your application while waiting for the response.


    Version:
    6.1
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Detail

      • routeRegister

        RouteRegisterResponse routeRegister(RouteRegister request)
                             throws CstaException
        Register as a routing server for a specified device or for all devices within the switch sub-domain.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use RouteRegister.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         RouteRegister request = new RouteRegister(); 
 // deviceID is a DeviceID that was retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 // If deviceID is null, the routing server will be monitoring all devices in the switch sub-domain. 
 request.setRouteingDevice(deviceID);
 
 // must set up switch name as private data 
 RouteRegisterPrivateData privData = new RouteRegisterPrivateData();
 privData.setSwitchNameList(switchName);
 CSTACommonArguments common = new CSTACommonArguments();
 common.setSinglePrivateData(privData);
 request.setExtensions(common);
      
 RouteRegisterResponse response = routeSvcs.RouteRegister(request);
 
 // print the Route Register Request ID of the device
 String routeRegisterReqId = response.getRouteRegisterReqID();
 System.out.println("Device: " + deviceID.getContent(); + 
      " routeRegisterReqID: " + routeRegisterReqId);
 
 // create RouteingListener instance to monitor request/event from switch
 MyRouteingListener listener = new MyRouteingListener();
 routeSvcs.addRouteingListener(routeRegisterReqId, listener);
        Parameters:
        request - A RouteRegister request that contains a DeviceID of the device on which the routing service is provided. If DeviceID is NULL, then the routing server is for all devices in the switch sub-domain.
        Returns:
        A RouteRegisterResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if an invalid device ID has been specified.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the user is busy or there is no idle appearance available.
        ResourceOutOfServiceException - Thrown if the request is ending abnormally due to protocol error..
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • routeRegisterCancel

        RouteRegisterCancelResponse routeRegisterCancel(RouteRegisterCancel request)
                                         throws CstaException
        Cancel the routing server registration for a specified device(s).

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use RouteRegisterCancel.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         RouteRegisterCancel request = new RouteRegisterCancel(); 
 // routeRegisterReqId is a ID that was retrieved from RouteRegister  
 request.setRouteRegisterReqID(routeRegisterReqId);
 RouteRegisterCancelResponse response = routeSvcs.RouteRegisterCancel(request);
      
 // remove the routeingListener
 routeSvcs.removeRouteingListener(routeRegisterReqId);
        Parameters:
        request - A RouteRegisterCancel request that contains a route register request ID that was received from the RouteRegister for the routing service.
        Returns:
        A RouteRegisterCancelResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if an invalid device ID has been specified.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the user is busy or there is no idle appearance available.
        ResourceOutOfServiceException - Thrown if the request is ending abnormally due to protocol error..
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • routeEnd

        void routeEnd(RouteEnd request)
       throws CstaException
        Inform swtich function that no route can be provided for this call.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use RouteEnd.
        No positive acknowledgement associated with the request. 

         RouteEnd request = new RouteEnd();
 // routeRegisterReqID is the ID to identify the routing server from RouteRegisterResponse
 // routeCrossRefID is a ID to identify the routing dialog from RouteRequest
 request.setRouteRegisterReqID(routeRegisterReqID);
 request.setCrossRefIdentifier(routeCrossRefID);
 ErrorValue errorValue = new ErrorValue();
 errorValue.setOperation(OperationErrors.GENERIC);
 request.setErrorValue(errorValue);
 routeSvcs.RouteEnd(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A RouteEnd request that contains a route cross reference identifier of this routing dialog.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if an invalid device ID has been specified.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the user is busy or there is no idle appearance available.
        ResourceOutOfServiceException - Thrown if the request is ending abnormally due to protocol error..
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • routeSelect

        void routeSelect(RouteSelect request)
          throws CstaException
        Provide the destination requesterd by the previous Route Request.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use RouteSelect.
        No positive acknowledgement associated with the request. 

         RouteSelect request = new RouteSelect();
 // routeRegisterReqID is the ID to identify the routing server from RouteRegisterResponse
 // routeCrossRefID is a ID to identify the routing dialog from RouteRequest 
 // routeSelected is the destination application is providing 
 // set RouteUsedReq to true to expect receiving a RouteUsed event after the routing 
 request.setRouteRegisterReqID(routeRegisterReqID);
 request.setCrossRefIdentifier(routeCrossRefID);
 request.setRouteSelected(routeSelected);
 request.setRouteUsedReq(true);
 routeSvcs.RouteSelect(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A RouteSelect request that contains a route cross reference identifier from the RouteRequest, a destination for routing the call, and optional call information in the RouteSelectPrivateData private data.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if an invalid device ID has been specified.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the user is busy or there is no idle appearance available.
        ResourceOutOfServiceException - Thrown if the request is ending abnormally due to protocol error..
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • routeReject

        void routeReject(RouteReject request)
          throws CstaException
        Not supported
        Throws:
        ServiceNotSupportedException.
        CstaException

      • addRouteingListener

        void addRouteingListener(java.lang.String routeRegisterReqId,
                         RouteingListener listener)
                  throws CstaException
        Add a RouteingListener instance to monitor the routing requests/events received from the switch. To learn how to use listeners to monitor events, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use addRouteingListener.

        
 RouteRegisterResponse response = routeSvcs.routeRegister(RouteRegisterReqId);
 String routeRegsiterReqId = response.getRouteRegisterReqID();
 
 // create RouteingListener instance
 MyRouteingListener listener = new MyRouteingListener();
 routeSvcs.addRouteingListener(routeRegisterReqId, listener);
        Parameters:
        routeRegisterReqId - The registation request ID that retruned from the RouteRequestResponse.
        listener - The listener instance of RouteingListener
        Throws:
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • removeRouteingListener

        void removeRouteingListener(java.lang.String routeRegisterReqId)
                     throws CstaException
        Remove the RouteingListener that monitors the routing requests/events received from the switch.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use removeRouteingListener.

             
 // remove the RouteingListener
 routeSvcs.removeRouteingListener(routeRegisterReqId);
 RouteRegisterCancelResponse response = routeSvcs.routeRegisterCancel(RouteRegisterReqId);
        Parameters:
        routeRegisterReqId - The registation request ID that retruned from the RouteRequestResponse.
        Throws:
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.
